subject: p15438386
History: -year-old male with history of slurred speech.
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Mild bibasilar atelectasis is seen. Subtle opacity at the right lung base most likely represents atelectasis, less likely consolidation. No definite discrete focal consolidation is seen. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette is top normal to mildly enlarged. The aorta is calcified and tortuous. Degenerative changes are seen along the spine.
